trends: There have been 83 other sightings in Omaha
There were no other sightings in Omaha on or around October 2nd 2007
divs: sighting detailsit was 9:40 p.m. central daylight time, october 2, 2007. i was standing on my back deck waiting for my dog. we have a very nice view of the night sky to the north when it's clear which it was tonight. i regularly see meteors and satilites, it was these and the stars in general that i was looking at and\or for. i happened to see a very faint meteor that looked like it was very far up in the atmosphere becuase they are usually much brighter. this was to the north\northeast. after that got my attention, i continued to scan the sky further to the north when i seen a triangle shape flying from north\northeast to south\southwest. it had no lights what so-ever. because of this it was virtually invisible against the night sky. i have very good eyesight though and was able to make out just the front of the object which was triangle shaped, just more spread apart. i could not make out the rest of it however, but it definitly had mass because it blocked out a few stars as it passed overhead. it was so nearly invisible against the night sky and that it had no sound if you wasn't looking up at the right exact moment or have fair to bad eyesight, you would have never known it was there. it was completly silent! i could not say with any accuracy how big it was or how fast it was moving ( the whole thing took just long enough to fly over and disappear over the houses, just seconds ) or how far up it was. i look at the night sky every night and have never seen anything like this!! wow!!! we also live near an approach pattern to epply airfield. i've seen many planes at all altitudes at all hours of the day and night. this was not a plane! i didn't know what it was when i first saw it, so i really focused on it and knew it was never anything i have seen before. i think i may have even quit breathing for a few seconds. virtually invisible with no lights, completly soundless and triangle shape. that's about it.
Summary: Fly over, no lights, almost invisible, no sound
